heading: Becoming a Skeeball Master
content: We ran across this NEWS ITEM at Yahoo and thought we'd share. Maybe it'll help raise your scores!

heading: Winter tournament results
content: The Spy Guys came out on top in the winter league tournament last night (March 9th)... taking home their 3rd title (2nd consecutively)... winning 4 games to 2 in the final match. Once again, it came at the expense of Marble Rye, who have been the runner up in each of those 3 Spy Guy title seasons. One of the big surprises of the night was the Skeet Skeet Skeeballaz (of Macedonia) who entered the tournament as a #23 seed, but that didn't stop them from knocking off 2 of the top teams in the tournament (#2 Mean Mom and Company and #7 That's What Skee Said) in back-to-back matches before falling to Marble Rye in the final 4.

heading: Canton does the Harlem Shake
content: Check out the Canton Winking Lizard doin' the Harlem Shake on youtube. Well done Canton!

heading: Spring tournament results
content: For the third consecutive season, the Spy Guys win the tournament. They lost their first game of the night, but that turned out to be their lone loss of the evening. Their string of wins culminated with 4 straight in the final match against first-time finalists The Brownski's. The Brownski's made it to the final match with back-to-back wins over 2 of the top teams in the tournament (That's What Skee Said and Mean Mom and Company).

heading: Fall tournament results
content:
That's What Skee Said came out on top at Saturday night's tournament. That was not a big surprise... since they did score more regular season points than any other team in the league. What was a big surprise was the runner up in the tournament. Skeeballz From Hell (Mentor) was that surprise team. They rolled through the #2 ranked Spy Guys, #7 ranked Skee Amigos and #3 ranked Out of Skeetirement in consecutive matches before coming up short in the final. Interestingly enough, there were no 700+ games rolled all night by any player. Also of note... Matt Lorenzo (That's What Skee Said) not only was part of the title winning team, but he also was the winner of the 55" TV in the raffle.

Pics of the festivities can be seen in Sal's Online Photo Album.

heading: Winter tournament results
content:
Congratulations to the winners of the Winter 2014 Skeeball Tournament: BumbleSkee Tuna from Macedonia!

Honorable mention goes to Tony's Tribe from Mentor for winning the ilustrious "losers" bracket! And, Beans from GBSkee won the grand prize 60" TV. Congratulations to her!

For a link to pictures of all the festivities and fun click HERE!

If you are interested in signing up for the Spring 2014 league head on over to HERMES now!

heading: Spring tournament results
content:
Rick Miller not only won the individual 'Best Season Average' during the regular season, but he also lead his team, Out of Skeetirement (Brunswick) to the spring season title this past Saturday night (May 17th). Springskee & the Skee St. Band (Mentor), for the second straight season, had to settle for being runners up. They fell to Out of Skeetirement 4-0 in the final match.

The second chance bracket final featured a pair of Lakewood teams. In that final match, the Booskees edged out There's no Crying in Skeeball.

Sal didn't take as many pictures as normal in this event, but what pictures he did take can be viewed HERE.

heading: Pics from Mentor
content: (October 13th, 2014)

heading: Fall tournament results
content:
That's What Skee Said claimed another title (their 3rd) at the fall season's tournament by defeating first time finalist Skeeters this past Saturday night. As always, Sal's photos tell the tale of the evening better than any words that could be printed here, but it was a fun evening and everyone had a great time! As a side note, Tony's Tribe defeated the Beer Buddies in the second chance bracket. Tony's Tribe also won the second chance bracket last season.

Champions: That's What Skee Said

Runners Up: Skeeters

Second Chance Bracket Winners: Tony's Tribe

Grand Prize Winner: Vanessa Shockey

heading: Tournament info
content:
This season's Tournament will be taking place on Saturday, March 28th. As always, doors open at 5pm and matches start at 6pm. We'll be posting the tournament bracket as soon as all results are in and we've been able to process the feedback forms... removing the teams that let us know they won't be attending. We're hoping to have it posted by Tuesday, March 24th. The tournament will take place at the Winking Lizard Party Center in Bedford (located at: 25200 Miles Rd, in Bedford Heights)... just like it has for the past several seasons.

Everyone in the league is invited to attend and take part in:

  • $1,300 in drawing prizes (you must be present to win)
  • Free HUGE buffet
  • Special drink prices

If you are eliminated from the main tournament early, enter the second chance bracket. It's available to all teams that lose in the first round.

During the week off before the tournament, stop on down to your local Winking Lizard store to practice on Free Play Night! All skeeball machines will be on Free Play from 6 till closing on the following nights/locations:

  • Mentor - Tuesday
  • Bedford, Brunswick, Canton, Copley and Macedonia - Wednesday
  • Lakewood - Thursday

Here's a sneak preview of when the various prizes will be given away:

  • In the 7 o'clock hour - a Vizio 32" 1080p smart LED TV
  • In the 8 o'clock hour - a Sharp Aquos HD 1080p LED TV
  • In the 9 o'clock hour - a Vizio 50" 1080p smart LED TV

Please note: Players may bring their spouse or significant other to the tournament, but in order to qualifier to win the above prizes, you must have actually played in the league during the season.

heading: Updated tournament info
content:
The tournament rankings are final and the TOURNAMENT BRACKET has been set!

For more info about the event, check out the TOURNAMENT FLYER.

heading: Winter tournament results
content:
That's What Skee Said (Canton) claimed yet another title (now their their 4th) at the winter season's tournament by defeating first time finalist It Burns When I Skee (also from Canton) this past Saturday night. Sal's photos are also available for viewing.

Champions: That's What Skee Said

And the tournament wasn't the only thing That's What Skee Said won on Saturday night... they also won the two biggest prizes in the random drawing.

Second Chance Bracket winners: Balls Deep

heading: Big round in Mentor
content: Uncle Drew's (Mentor-Tuesday) scored the 4th most points in a match in Skeeball World Tour history last night.

heading: First 810 of the season
content: Tom Cole (Lakewood-Thursday) just rolled the season's first 800+ game last night... the second 810 of his skeeball career.

heading: 900 in Mentor
content: Frank Ferrato became the second player in Skeeball World Tour history to roll a perfect 900 during regular season league play last night. His team (Team Polycoat) rolled an impressive 14,160 in the match... the 6th most ever.

heading: Theme night in Lakewood
content: Sean Drapac, Jeovanna Drapac and Valerie Cintula of Gettin' Friskee had Theme Night on Tuesday in Lakewood. That theme was "Fishing: fisherman and his catch".

heading: Theme Night in Lakewood
content: Another 'Theme Night' in Lakewood for Sean Drapac, Jeovanna Drapac and Valerie Cintula of Gettin' Friskee. This time you guess the theme.

heading: Fall Season Tournament
content:
The 2015 Fall Season Tournament will be held on Saturday, November 21st at its usual location... the Winking Lizard Party Center, located at: 25380 Miles Rd in Bedford Heights (MAP). As always, doors open at 5pm and matches start at 6pm.

Everyone in the league (plus a significant other) is welcome to attend, regardless of whether your team has qualified to play. Make that 'encouraged' to attend. It's a lot of fun, plus there is a great All-You-Can-Eat Buffet and this season's prizes will be $500, $350 and $250 Amazon Gift Cards. Everyone that played in the league is eligible to win the prizes, which are drawn randomly throughout the night. You must fill out a raffle ticket (one per player) upon arriving and you must be present to win.

Teams that lose in the first round of the main tournament are eligible to compete in the Second Chance Bracket. Rules will be posted at the tournament.

heading: Tournament Bracket
content: The Tournament Bracket for Saturday's event has been finalized. See you all at the Tournament!

heading: Copley Free Play Practice Night
content: Players at the Copley store tuning up their skeeball skills for the Tournament:

heading: 2015 Fall Tournament Results
content:
Team Polycoat (Mentor) took home the championship for an unprecedented 9th time (with a few of those coming in the pre-SkeeballWorldTour.com era) by defeating Miami Skeat (Brunswick) in 7 games.

Down 3 games to 2, Frank Ferrato rolled an 810 in the anchor position to keep Team Polycoat alive and they eventually won the 7th game.

The Beer Buddies (Mentor) were 3rd place finishers... making their first appearance in the final 4 as they beat another surprise final 4 participant, Team Zero Tickets (Bedford Heights), in the consolation match.

Over in the Second Chance Bracket, the Skeeball Lizards (Brunswick) came out victorious.

Winners of the $250, $350 and $500 Amazon Gift Cards:

As always, Sal's Pictures of the Event are now online for viewing.

heading: Latest News
content:
The new season begins next week and the schedules have been posted... with the exception of Brunswick (Monday). There were some errors in their schedule and we're working to correct them. We'll be posting them as soon as they're available.

UPDATE: (2015-01-09) Brunswick (Monday) schedules have been corrected and are now online.

Brunswick and Canton stores Note: Teams playing against Ghost Teams this season will notice a change in their name. Ghost Teams are now called Ghost Team 660... reflecting a change in the score you'll have to beat per game when playing against a Ghost Team. In the past, Ghost Teams scored 690 per game, but this season they will score 660 per game.

Good luck in the new season!

heading: Last minute schedule changes
content:
PLEASE NOTE: There have been last minute schedule changes to the Brunswick (both Monday and Wednesday) and Macedonia stores. In a nutshell, two new teams have been added to Macedonia and a team from Brunswick (Wednesday) has switched over to Brunswick (Monday)... eliminating the need for Ghost Teams on both nights.

Changes to all the affected stores have been made to the schedules posted on this website.

heading: Player of the Week
Winter Tournament Update
content:
There have been a few changes to the March 19th Winter Season Tournament. Before spelling out the changes, let's talk about what's going to be the same. It'll be held at it's usual location (the Winking Lizard Party Center in Bedford Heights). There will be plenty of great prizes. Everyone in attendance is eligible to win... whether or not you qualify to play the tournament... but you do have to be present to win. The Second Chance Bracket remains for teams eliminated from the first round.

Now onto the changes. We're reducing the number of tournament teams from 54 to 32. This will not only make the tournament an hour and a half shorter, but it will also reduce the number of no-shows (forfeited matches) greatly. In addition to reducing the total number of tournament teams, changes have been made to the criteria involved in qualifying. The number of automatic qualifiers per store has been reduced, placing somewhat more emphasis on points and somewhat less emphasis on record. Needing to do this became obvious once we reduced the number of teams to 32. The end result is a more competitive tournament, while still ensuring that each store has adequate representation regardless of their point totals.

The Current Tournament Qualifiers (and their ranking order) are available for viewing. Keep in mind... even though you might not see your name in the list, you may still qualify when the final rankings are listed. During the final week of the season, we poll all teams as to whether they plan on attending the tournament. Teams that say no are removed from the rankings and are replaced by other teams that are coming. So, don't count your team out until after the season ends and the rankings are listed as 'Final'.

More will be posted concerning the specifics of the tournament in the next week.

heading: Free Skeeball Night
content:
Come on down and practice up for the March 19th Tournament at Free Skeeball Night. Each store will have a free play night as follows:

  • Mentor, Brunswick - Monday, March 14th
  • Lakewood - Tuesday, March 15th
  • Bedford, Canton, Copley, Macedonia - Wednesday, March 16th

Machines will be on free play from 6pm till close and all are welcome to play... regardless of whether you play in the league.

heading: Winter Tournament
content:
The 2016 Winter Skeeball Tournament will be held this Saturday (March 19th) at the Winking Lizard Party Center (25200 Miles Rd, Bedford Heights). Doors open at 5:00pm and games start at 6:00pm.

Everyone who played in the league (plus their significant other or a friend) is welcome to attend, even if you didn't qualify to partipate in the tournament... though you must have played in the league to qualify to win prizes.

There will be a great complimentary buffet, the main tournament, the second chance bracket, a huge raffle and a guaranteed great time!

We will be giving away $1,100.00 in Amazon Gift Cards throughout the evening. You must have played at least 1 week during this season and you must be present to win. Here is the schedule of the gift card drawings:

  • 6:30pm drawing for a $100 Amazon Gift Card
  • 7:00pm drawing for a $200 Amazon Gift Card
  • 8:00pm drawing for a $300 Amazon Gift Card
  • 9:00pm drawing for a $500 Amazon Gift Card

This season's tournament has been trimmed down to 32 teams. Check your team's status... the Tournament Rankings are now final.

The Second Chance Bracket is back! If your team loses in the first round of the main tournament, you can signup to keep playing in the second chance bracket. 7:30 is the deadline to signup. The winners of the second chance bracket will receive '3' $25 Lizard Loot Cards, while the runners up will receive '3' $10 Lizard Loot Cards.

heading: Winter Tournament Results
content:
That's What Skee Said claimed their 5th title in the March 19th Winter Skeeball Tournament, defeating Miami Skeet (who also happened to be last season's runner-up) in the final. The final round went 7 games and was decided on the very last ball. Matt Lorenzo (the final player on the home team in game 7) needed a 100 on his last ball to pull out the victory... and he nailed it!

For the first time ever (at least in memory), the top 4 teams in the tournament (That's What Skee Said - Canton, Skeeterifics - Lakewood, Miami Skeet - Brunswick and Scoopskee Potatoes - Mentor) made it to the final 4. Also of note... Rick (lefty) Miller of Miami Skeet rolled the only 700+ game of the night. The rest of the story is that he broke his right wrist the day before the season began and was forced to play the whole season... including the tournament... left-handed.

Over in the Second Chance Bracket, the Skeezy Old Bastards knocked off the Leahy girls of Sweet Baby Skeesus in the final match to claim the honors.

Raffle Prize Winners are shown below (Top, left to right: Lori Byrne-Macedonia, Cara Wilson-Mentor and bottom, left to right: Allison Galioto-Brunswick, Arlene Barcouza-Brunswick).

 

As always, Sal's Photos of the event are available for viewing.

heading: Fall Skeeball Season
content:
The Fall Skeeball Season begins September 12th and Registration is now open! The league will be at the following stores/nights.

  • Brunswick (Monday and Wednesday)
  • Canton (Wednesday)
  • Copley (Wednesday)
  • Lakewood (Tuesday and Thursday)
  • Macedonia (Wednesday)
  • Mentor (Tuesday and Thursday)

Each store has a maximum number of teams. Signup soon so you don't miss out! Registration ends September 8th.

Hermes is no longer associated with Skeeball World Tour, but outside of registration being handled by the Winking Lizard website, nothing will be changing... except the cost of registration has been lowered to $45 per team. T-shirts are scheduled to be in around the 3rd or 4th week of the season and we're looking to have even more prizes than ever at the tournament.

heading: Fall skeeball season starts Monday
content:
Registration for the fall skeeball season has ended and the new season will begin the week of September 12th at the following stores:

  • Brunswick (Monday and Wednesday)
    Canton (Wednesday)
    Copley (Wednesday)
    Lakewood (Thursday)
    Macedonia (Wednesday)
    Mentor (Tuesday and Thursday)

As you see, Lakewood has been merged into a single night (Thursday). All other stores will proceed as normal.

UPDATE: the upcoming season schedule was posted at around 2pm on the 9th, but an error was discovered with the Copley store. That error was corrected at 4:30pm and now all the stores' schedules are set.

Good luck in the new skeeball season!

heading: Sad day
content: It's a sad day for Skeeball World Tour. Long time Beer Buddy, Dave Lory passed away on Sunday September 18th while in recovery from Meningitus. Ironman Dave is still the all-time leader in games played at Skeeball World Tour. Dave's full obituary can be seen HERE. Dave was a good guy and will be missed by everyone at the Mentor store and far beyond. Dave was 54 years old.

heading: Fall 2016 Tournament Results
content:
Claiming the November 19th Fall Skeeball Tournament title was Born to Skee wild (Mentor... shown below) as they defeated Jen Parker's Skee-veland Rocks! (Brunswick). The final round again went 7 games, though it wasn't looking good for the eventual champs, as they lost the first 3 games of the best-of-7 match. Anchorman Dirt Guthleben pulled off some late heroics in game 4 to keep Born to Skee wild alive, then stepped up in the bottom of game 7 needing a 380 to secure the title. Dirt nailed a 390 to narrowly secure the win in one of the best comebacks in Skeeball World Tour history.

Skeeterifics (Lakewood) and Scoopskee Potatoes (Mentor) rounded out the final 4, but came up just short of the final.

Over in the Second Chance Bracket, the Balls of Fury (Mentor... shown below) knocked off Mean Mom and Company (Brunswick) in the final match to claim the honors.

Raffle Prize Winners are shown below (left to right): Ashley Lorenzo - Canton, Mike Pivato - Brunswick and Randy Shockey - Mentor.

 

As always, Sal's Photos of the event are available for viewing.

content:
Schedules have been posted for the Winter Skeeball season. matches start next week... the week of January 16th.

Happy Rolling!

heading: Winter Season in the Books
content:
Last night marked the end of the Winter Skeeball season.

A quick review of the Winter season's top achievers shows the following players atop the high individual averages category:

  1. Matt Lorenzo - (Canton) 472.3 (5th best All-Time)
  2. Tom Cole - (Lakewood) 463.7 (6th best All-Time)
  3. Brian Kampman - (Mentor) 419.3

Members of the 800 Club (all with 810's) this season were:

  • Nick Galioto - (Brunswick)... 6th of his career
  • Matt Lorenzo - (Canton)... 6th of his career
  • Jeff Lipinski - (Brunswick)

The top team (points-wise) for the 6th consecutive season is: That's What Skee Said (Canton, 110230 Total Points)... good enough for the 6th best average per game on the All-Time List.

The top team (record-wise) also happens to be: That's What Skee Said (Canton, 80-10-0 Record).

heading: Winter 2017 Tournament Results
content:
Last season's runners-up, Skee-veland Rocks!, took the next step at Saturday's Winter Skeeball Tournament winning their first title... knocking off many-time past champs, That's What Skee Said. After losing the first game, Steve Krivos' clutch 640 narrowly won game 2 to even the match for Skee-veland Rocks!. Three more straight close games found Skee-veland Rocks! up 3 games to 2. In game 6, Brett Marcis (a mid-season recruit who was called upon as a replacement due to Nick Galiato's paternity leave), rolled a 540... after having only one 500+ game in his Skeeball World Tour career... to lead Skee-veland Rocks! to victory.

Seekin' A Skeesome (Copley) and Scoopskee Potatoes (Mentor) rounded out the final 4, but came up just short of the final.

Over in the Second Chance Bracket, Run D-M Skee (Copley... shown below) knocked off The Wannaskees (Brunswick) in the final match to claim the honors.

Raffle Prize Winners ($100, $200 and $500 Amazon Gift Cards) are shown below (left to right): Jeanna Coleman - Macedonia, Sandy Guthleben - Mentor and Jason Platzgraf - Canton.

 

As always, Sal's Photos of the event are available for viewing.

The 2017 Fall Skeeball Tournament will be held Saturday (November 18th) at the Winking Lizard Party Center (25200 Miles Rd, Bedford Heights). Doors open at 5:00pm and matches start at 6:00pm.

Everyone who played in the league (plus their significant other or a friend) is welcome to attend... even if you didn't qualify to partipate in the tournament, though you must have played in the league to qualify to win prizes. Skeeball World Tour is a 21 and older league... as is this tournament.

There will be a great complimentary All-You-Can-Eat Buffet, the main tournament, the Second Chance Bracket, a huge Raffle and a guaranteed great time!

We will be giving away $800.00 in Amazon Gift Cards throughout the evening. You must have played at least 1 week during this season to qualify and you must be present to win! Here is the schedule of the gift card drawings:

  • 8:00pm drawing for a $200 Amazon Gift Card
  • 9:00pm drawing for a $500 Amazon Gift Card

Current Tournament Qualifiers are available for viewing and will be made final after all games have been played. The Tournament Bracket is expected to be posted on November 13th.

The Winners of the tournament will receive '3' $50 Amazon Gift Cards, while the runners up will receive '3' $25 Amazon Gift Cards.

heading: Tournament Bracket
content: The Tournament Bracket for Saturday's event has been finalized. See you all at the Tournament!

heading: Fall 2017 Tournament Results
content:
Last season's champion, Skee-veland Rocks! (Brunswick), made it two in a row (and 3rd straight season in the finals)... when they came back to beat Skeet and Potatoes (Copley). After losing the first 2 games, Skee-veland Rocks! picked it up and had a combined '7' 440+ scores (including a pair of 540's by Brett Marcis) in the next 4 frames... winning all 4 of them to close it out. Skeet and Potatoes was out of gas over those final 4 frames and couldn't muster a single 400+ game over that span.

Skeet and Potatoes dodged a bullet 2 rounds earlier, narrowly getting past Seekin' A Skeesome. Tied at 3 game apiece, it came down to the final player (Tony Rome), who needed a 500+ game to win the game and match. Tony calmly rolled a 540... and then wasn't so calm.

Also in the final four, but coming up a little short were a pair of teams from Mentor (Born to Skee Wild and Scoopskee Potatoes).

Over in the Second Chance Bracket, Sweet Baby Skeesus (Lakewood... shown below) knocked off Alaskan Pipeliners (Copley)  in the final match to claim the honors.

Raffle Prize Winners ($100, $200 and $500 Amazon Gift Cards) are shown below (left to right): Sonya Snyder - Mentor, Mike Austin - Macedonia and Chuck Lewis - Macedonia.

 

As always, Sal's Photos of the event are available for viewing.

heading: Registration Ending Soon

heading: Winter Skeeball Season Schedules
content:
Sorry for the delay in getting all the schedules posted for the upcoming Winter Skeeball season, but they are finally all posted.

Good luck in the new skeeball season!

heading: 3 in a row
content:
PJ Turosky (Mentor) has become the first player in Skeeball World Tour history to roll 3 consecutive 720s. He pulled off the feat on March 8th in frames 5 through 7 and finished with 4610 points on the evening.

Note: In the Fall season of 2012, someone did roll a 720,720 and 900 consecutively... but technically not 3 straight 720s.

heading: Winter 2018 Tournament Results
content:
It was an 'ALL POTATO' final this year in the Winter 2018 Skeeball World Tour Tournament. Last season's runner-up, Skeet and Potatoes (Copley) was facing off against Mentor's Scoopskee Potatoes. The latter Potatoes actually finished in 4th place on Tuesday night in Mentor during the regular season, but had the good fortune of having one of their regular players (Greg Lyons) not able to make it to the tournament. With a fill-in player in tow, Brian Kampman picked up the slack in leading Scoopskee Potatoes to a sweep of Skeet and Potatoes. Three of his four games in the final match were 630's... after rolling a pair or 720's in the team's semi-final match (equaling his total number of 700+ games during the regular season in a single match).

Rounding out the final four, but coming up a little short were (UnbeSKEEvable (Macedonia) and Rule #7Skee6 (Mentor). UnbeSKEEvable was the top team in the league this season and were the favorites going into the tournament... while Rule #7Skee6 was the top team at Mentor (Tuesday) this season.

Over in the Second Chance Bracket, the HungLo (Mentor... shown below) knocked off the Alley Cats (Macedonia)  in the final match to claim the honors.

Raffle Prize Winners ($100, $200 and $500 Amazon Gift Cards) are shown below (left to right): Megan McPherran (Copley), Ross Fatica (Macedonia) and Deb Leahy (Lakewood).

 

As always, Sal's Photos of the event are available for viewing.

heading: 900 Game in Macedonia
content:
Justin Meeson (Hounds of Skeeball) rolled the 5th ever regular season Skeeball World Tour perfect 900 game last night in Macedonia!

It's been 3 years since the last perfect 900 game in this league. Congrats to Justin!

heading: Pair of 810's
content: On the heels of a perfect 900 game in Macedonia... over in Lakewood... Deb Leahy (Skeeterrifics) pulled off an even more rare feat. For only the 3rd time in Skeeball World Tour history, she rolled a pair of 800+ games in a single match. This was the first time in 6 years anyone has done it. Nice work Deb!

heading: Week 2 Players of the Week
Week 3 Players of the Week
Week 4 Players of the Week
Week 5 Players of the Week
Week 6 Players of the Week
(Another) 900 Game in Macedonia
content:
Ethan Taylor rolled the 2nd 900 game of the season at the Macedonia store on Wednesday night. It's Ethan's first season playing in Macedonia, after switching over from the Copley store.

We're now up to six 900 games in Skeeball World Tour history! Nice rollin' Ethan!

heading: Final Tournament Rankings
content:
The season is now over and the TOURNAMENT RANKINGS have been set as 'Final'. Teams that told us they aren't coming to the tournament are not included in the rankings. If you see any errors or ommisions in the rankings, please let us know.

The November 17th tournament is right around the corner. More info will be posted about the tournament later today.

Also, the printable PDF TOURNAMENT BRACKET is now available. Please let us know ASAP if something looks incorrect.

heading: Fall Skeeball Tournament
content:
The 2018 Fall Skeeball Tournament will be held Saturday (November 17th) at the Winking Lizard Party Center (25200 Miles Rd, Bedford Heights). Doors open at 5:00pm and matches start at 6:00pm.

Everyone who played in the league (plus their significant other or a friend) is welcome to attend... even if you didn't qualify to partipate in the tournament, though you must have played in the league to qualify to win prizes. Skeeball World Tour is a 21 and older league... as is this tournament.

There will be a great complimentary All-You-Can-Eat Buffet, the main tournament, the Second Chance Bracket, a huge Raffle and a guaranteed great time!

We will be giving away $800.00 in Amazon Gift Cards throughout the evening. You must have played at least 1 week during this season to qualify and you must be present to win! Here is the schedule of the gift card drawings:

  • 7:15pm drawing for a $100 Amazon Gift Card
  • 8:15pm drawing for a $200 Amazon Gift Card
  • 9:15pm drawing for a $500 Amazon Gift Card

The Winners of the tournament will receive '3' $50 Amazon Gift Cards, while the runners up will receive '3' $25 Amazon Gift Cards.

The Second Chance Bracket is back! If your team loses in the first round of the main tournament, you can signup to keep playing in the Second Chance Bracket. 7:15pm is the deadline to signup. The winners of the second chance bracket will receive '3' $25 Lizard Loot Cards.

heading: Fall 2018 Tournament Results
content:
Twelve was the lucky number for the Whiskee Shots in Saturday night's Fall Skeeball Tournament. The #12 ranked Whiskee Shots showed up with their A-game... knocking off the #1 ranked UnbeSKEEvable in the final four, before beating #2 ranked Miami Skeat in the finals. This season's final was a nail biter and wasn't an easy road for the eventual champs. Up 3 games to 2, it looked like they'd win in 6 games... but Miami Skeats' anchor had other thoughts. Needing a 540 to send the match to a 7th game, Rick Miller rolled a cool 630 to keep his team alive. Game 7 provided an even greater challenge. Rick's turn came up with him needing an 810 in the final game of the night the salvage the championship. He nailed 5 of his first 6 in the 100 hole, giving his team hope that an 810 was possible... but missed on his final 3 balls. This was the 3rd time Miami Skeat has made it to the finals, but had to settled for runner-up honors each time. As for the Whiskee Shots, Brian McPherran, Lindsey Borstein and Josh Borstein (left to right in the picture below) each played great all night and capitalized on it in their first ever trip to the finals.

Last season's champions, Scoopskee Potatoes, were relegated to the Second Chance Bracket this season (after losing in the first round). But, they did prevail in at least taking home the less distinguished title this time around... knocking off Skee U Next Wednesday with a 3-game sweep in the final.

Raffle Prize Winners ($100, $200 and $500 Amazon Gift Cards) are shown below (left to right): Rena Grida (Copley), Ed Zukowski (Copley) and Chuck Lewis (Macedonia). An interesting side note about this year's $500 Amazon Gift Card winner... Chuck Lewis also won the top prize at the Fall Tournament in 2017.

 

As always, Sal's Photos of the event are available for viewing.

heading: New items on this website
content:
After having it on our to-do list for several seasons, we finally have a list of the yearly Skeeball World Tour champions on the website. It's on the top navigation bar next to 'Contact Us'.

Also new is the ability to access your team's stats for every year they've played in the league... just like it has always been available for your player stats.

heading: Whiskee Shots' night to remember, remembered
content:
For the recently crowned first-time champion Whiskee Shots, November 17th was a night to remember. Now, thanks to Brian, Lindsey and Josh the rest of us can get a first hand view of what that night was like for them in their quest for the title.

This very well done video speaks for itself:

https://youtu.be/2NE1ppLCsmw
